content.question:
<math alttext="2 A g N O 3 aqueous plus C a C l 2 aqueous react to produce 2 A g C l solid plus C a, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2 aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>AgCl(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Ca</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Substance 
Approximate <math alttext="S naught in joules per mole kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>(J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K))</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="A g N O 3 aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
220 

<math alttext="C a C l 2 aqueous " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="60 decimal point" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60.</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="A g C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AgCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> 
96 

<math alttext="C a, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2 aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Ca(</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
240 

The reaction between <math alttext="A g N O 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C a C l 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the equation above, and the table provides the approximate <math alttext="S naught " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> values for the reactants and products. Which of the following is the approximate <math alttext="delta S naught " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 68 joules per mole of reaction kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>68</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>J/(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
